But the Bible teaches us the imminent return of Jesus Christ. And this morning, as we are celebrating Memorial Day as a nation, tomorrow of course the official observance, there's some things no doubt that we need to remember as Americans. There are some things no doubt that have not been adequately and properly taught to a new generation about the sacrifice that was made by millions of people for us to enjoy the freedom that we have today. What a blessing that is. And I'm thankful to be American, to live in this nation. But my citizenship is in heaven. I'm a child of the King. Amen? I've been born again. We sang the song this morning since I have been redeemed. I have dual citizenship, American, but heaven is my home. The songwriter said, this road is not my home, I'm just a passing through. And oh, how we can relate to the songwriter. And as the people of God, just as the warning is given in Deuteronomy chapter number 6, when you're entered into the land that I've promised to give you, when I bring you into that land, God did it, God worked, God proved His power and He brought the children of Israel into the land. And Moses says, beware lest thou forget the Lord. So there were some things that the children of Israel were instructed to do to establish memorials so that they would not forget what God did for them. We find that Peter says, I'll put you in remembrance of some things. I want you to be mindful of some things. We understand the Lord's given us the truth as New Testament believers of baptism and the Lord's Supper. In fact, the table that is before me says, this do in remembrance of me. You can read in 1 Corinthians 11 and you can see how the Lord's table, it's a table of remembrance. It's a memorial to be mindful of what the Lord Jesus Christ did for me to remember what my salvation cost. It was free to me, but Jesus died. Yes, He was buried and He rose in victory and how we rejoice in that truth. But this morning, as the people of God living in a day of confusion and chaos, and there are people that are discouraged and confused, I want you to remember that the Lord's still on His throne. I want you to remember that the Lord's still building His church. I want you to remember the Lord's still saving sinners. And I want you to remember that the Lord is coming again. And we remember those things and I, as I admitted in the beginning of the message, there's 50 other things that we could speak about that we need to remember. Remember those four things. I believe it'll help us. It'll help us in a time of chaos and confusion. Remember, Father, we love You. We thank You for loving us. We thank You for Your Word. How we rejoice that You have given us this precious Bible. The truth that is contained therein is profitable, is life-changing. And Lord, I pray that as we have reviewed these four items today, I've sought to stir us up by putting us in remembrance. I'm so thankful that You're sitting upon Your throne, that You are the Lord God omnipotent, that You reign, that You are King of kings and Lord of lords, the great I Am. How we rejoice in that. We thank You that You're still building Your church. It's Your church, not my church, not our church. I'm thankful to belong to the local church. I'm thankful to be part of the local church. I'm thankful for the privilege of being the under-shepherd of this local church. God, we know that You're the head. We believe the promise that You gave there in Matthew, I will build my church and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it. Oh, how we rejoice that You're still saving sinners. The gospel's powerful. What a joy to know that the truth, for whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved, is still in operation today. If there's one that's tuned in that's not sure of heaven, God, we pray that today is the day of salvation. They would not allow for another moment to pass by before they place their faith and trust in the finished work of Christ at Calvary. Understanding that their works, their good works, cannot get them to heaven, not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to His mercy hath He begotten us. For by grace are you saved through faith, and that not of yourselves, it is the gift of God, not of works, lest any man should boast. Our salvation is not based upon our works, it's not based upon our church membership, our baptism, any other thing. We're saved if we trust the Lord Jesus Christ as our personal Savior, receive the gift of God which is eternal life through the death, burial, and resurrection of our Savior. We thank You that You're still saving sinners, and then how we rejoice that You're still coming again. We readily admit we do not know the day nor hour, but we believe the promises that You've given us in Your Word, I will come again. That He that shall come will come, and will not tarry. God, I pray that You'd help us to redeem the time that we'd be busy about the Master's work, that we'd have that same level of urgency that we read of in the book of Acts, because we believe You're coming, and it could be at any moment. Lord, as we remember these things this morning, I pray that our hearts have been encouraged and strengthened. I pray that You'd give us a joy and a peace at the remembrance of these things. We pray that You'd work in the time of invitation, that You alone would be glorified, that decisions would be made here, would be made at the homes of those that have tuned in to watch this broadcast. Lord, that You would work in our hearts and lives, and that You alone would be glorified. We'll thank You for it, in Christ's name we pray, amen. Kimberly's going to play quietly on the piano, and as she does, hear the altars.
